section.title: Directory Services Support in oVirt
section.para: During installation oVirt Engine creates its own internal administration user, admin. This account is intended for use when initially configuring the environment, and for troubleshooting. To add other users to oVirt you will need to attach a directory server to the Manager using the Domain Management Tool, engine-manage-domains.

Once at least one directory server has been attached to the Manager you will be able to add users that exist in the directory server and assign roles to them using the Administration Portal. Users will be identified by their User Principle Name (UPN) of the form user@domain. Attachment of more than one Directory Server to the Manager is also supported.

You must ensure that the correct DNS records exist for your directory server. In particular you must ensure that the DNS records for the Directory Server include:
A valid pointer record (PTR) for the directory server's reverse look-up address.
A valid service record (SRV) for LDAP over TCP port 389.
A valid service record (SRV) for Kerberos over TCP port 88.
A valid service record (SRV) for Kerberos over UDP port 88.
If these records do not exist in DNS then you will be unable to add the domain to the oVirt Engine configuration using engine-manage-domains.

For more detailed information on installing and configuring a supported directory server, refer to the vendor's documentation:

important.para: A user must be created in the Directory Server specifically for use as the oVirt administrative user. Do not use the Directory Server's administrative user as the oVirt administrative user.

If you are using Active Directory as your Directory Server, and you wish to use sysprep in the creation of Templates and Virtual Machines, then the oVirt administrative user must be delegated control over the Domain to:
Join a computer to the domain
Modify the membership of a group
